Questions.QuestionString: The approved organizations which have to comply with AMC 20-22 for EWIS training are:
Answers: Part-21 and Part-145.
Part-21, Part-145 and Part-M.
Part-145 and Part-M.

Questions.QuestionString: What is Acceptable Means Compliance AMC 20-22 for?
Answers: EWIS maintenance & document program
Electrical & wiring maintenance program
EWIS training program

Questions.QuestionString: In the AMC 20-22, the target of groups 1 and 2 includes:
Answers: personnel carrying out maintenance of wiring systems and personnel carrying out EWIS inspection.
personnel carrying out design of wiring systems and personnel carrying out maintenance of wiring systems.
personnel carrying out EWIS inspection and personnel carrying out design of wiring systems.

Questions.QuestionString: About Acceptable Means Compliance AMC 20-21, which are causes of wire degradation:
Answers: Vibration, moisture, indirect damage, contamination, heat
Vibration, moisture, maintenance, heat
Vibration, moisture, maintenance, indirect damage, contamination, heat

Questions.QuestionString: Examples of EWIS are:
Answers: Wires, cables, busbars, connectors
Fiber optical cables
Portable electrical devices

Questions.QuestionString: EWIS tasks and inspections should be listed in the following ATA chapter:
Answers: ATA 25.
ATA 20.
ATA 12.

Questions.QuestionString: The owner/operator is responsible:
Answers: For determining if the EWIS has been changed (or affected by a change),
Ensuring that their maintenance program is enhanced as appropriate,
For determining if the EWIS has been changed (or affected by a change) and ensuring that their maintenance program is enhanced as appropriate.

Questions.QuestionString: Tools, equipment and test equipment must be calibrated to a standard acceptable to the:
Answers: MRO and traceable to International Standards.
MRO and traceable to the Authority.
Authority and traceable to International Standards.

Questions.QuestionString: The minimum radius of bends for thermocouple cable is:
Answers: Must not be less than 10 times the outside diameter of the cable.
Must not be less than 6 times the outside diameter of the cable.
Must not be less than 20 times the outside diameter of the cable.

Questions.QuestionString: The proper bend radius for wire on aircraft should be:
Answers: 3 times the outside diameter of the largest diameter wire in the bundle.
10 times the outside diameter of the largest diameter wire in the bundle for one side supported and 3 times for two sides supported.
10 times the outside diameter of the largest diameter wire in the bundle.

Questions.QuestionString: Bend radius for wire is suitably supported?
Answers: The radius may be 3 times the diameter of the wire or cable
Must not less than 10 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
Must not less than 7 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable

Questions.QuestionString: Bend radius RF cables
Answers: Not less than 10 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
Must not less than 7 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
Not less than 6 times the outside diameter of the cable

Questions.QuestionString: Bend radius for thermocouple wire?
Answers: The radius for thermocouple wire is 20 times the diameter. (This is very delicate wire.)
Not less than 10 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
Not less than 6 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable

Questions.QuestionString: Normally , minimum bend radius for wire groups or bundles:
Answers: Must not less than 10 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
Equal 9 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable
More than 5 times the outside diameter of the largest wire or cable

Questions.QuestionString: What is the minimum bend radius of a single co-axial cable?.
Answers: 10 * diameter.
8 * diameter.
6 * diameter

Questions.QuestionString: A wire routed within 6 inchs of a fuel line:
Answers: Wiring must above and maintained minimum of 2 inches with the fuel line.
The wiring is positively clamped to maintain at least 1/2-inch separation.
The wiring must be connected directly to the fluid-carrying equipment.

Questions.QuestionString: Mechanical strength of wire sizes:
Answers: Wires containing less than 20 conductor strands must not be used.
Wires smaller than #20 should be provided with additional clamps and be grouped with at least three other wires.

Mechanical strength of wire sizes less than #20, when subjected to excessive vibration, repeated bending, or frequent disconnection from screw termination, must have additional support at terminations.

Questions.QuestionString: In AWM route 1P meaning:
Answers: Power supply from 115VAC 1 phase
Power supply from Generator 1
Power supply from AC and DC bus 1

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of Circuit breaker auxiliary contact
Answers: To reduce load current of main contact
Back up if main contact tripped
Used to do a permanent check of main contact position

Questions.QuestionString: In a front release connector the pin will be.
Answers: released from the front and extracted from the rear
released from the rear and extracted from the front
released from the rear and extracted from the rear

Questions.QuestionString: In a front release connector the pin will be.
Answers: released from rear and extracted from the front.
released from the front and extracted from the front.
released from the front and extracted from the rear.

Questions.QuestionString: To find a high resistance or open circuit, carry out.
Answers: a milli-volt drop test.
a continuity check.
a bonding check.

Questions.QuestionString: When checking circuit breaker, relays, make sure that:
Answers: They are correctly installed,
There is no sign of overheat
Both answer are correct.

Questions.QuestionString: About wire/cable identification, what does the first 4 digit (number) means?
Answers: No. of the wire/cable in the circuit
No. of the circuit define by ATA Spec 100
No. of the color code

Questions.QuestionString: What is not acceptable when you do connector checking
Answers: Cable tie is missing
Make sure there is locking wire
There is no loosen connector or backshell

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement is not correct about wire harness?
Answers: Cable bend radius are not less than the minimum value necessary
Dust and lint do not need to be collect
There is no loose harness or incorrectly attached harness

Questions.QuestionString: When checking ground point, make sure that:
Answers: The ground equipment tighten to aircraft structure or avionic rack
The protective coating is not damaged
The ground equipment tighten to aircraft structure or avionic rack, the protective coating is not damaged, and no corrosion

Questions.QuestionString: When wiring is displaced, special attention should be given to:
Answers: Returning it to its normal configuration in accordance with the applicable maintenance instructions,
Check continuity and isolation of related wiring,
Perform operational test (or functional test) of related systems.

Questions.QuestionString: Proper wire selection, routing/separation, clamping configurations, use of splices, repair or replacement of protective coverings, pinning/de-pinning of connections… should be performed:
Answers: In accordance with the applicable sections of the Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM),
In accordance with the applicable sections of the Wiring Practices Manual (WPM),
In accordance with the applicable sections of the Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM), Wiring Practices Manual (WPM), or other…

Questions.QuestionString: The program to enhance EWIS maintenance also applies to:
Answers: EWIS installed,
EWIS modified, or affected by changes or STC (Supplemental Type Certificates),
EWIS installed, modified, or affected by changes or STC (Supplemental Type Certificates).

Questions.QuestionString: What types of EWIS inspection are included
Answers: General Visual insp, Zonal insp
General Visual insp, Zonal insp, Detail insp
General Visual Insp, Zonal insp, Detail insp, Aeging insp

Questions.QuestionString: Do you need to use special tool for GVI?
How to achieve adequate physical separation of EWIS
Answers: Only separation distance
By a barrier
Separation distance or by a barrier

Questions.QuestionString: Which type of EWIS inspection need to use Special Tool
Answers: General Visual inspection
Zonal inspection
Detail inspection

Questions.QuestionString: What is GVI inspection of EWIS
Answers: It is a visual examination of an internal or external area, installation or assembly for damage, failure or defect
It is necessary remove or move equipment items to visual examination.
It is necessary remove paint or sealant to visual examination

Questions.QuestionString: Detail Inspection is:
Answers: Visual examination of an internal or external area
Visual check of the system, powerplant or structure
Full examination of a specific component

Questions.QuestionString: What is zonal inspection
Answers: It is General visual inspection that you do in each zone, defined by access and area
It is Detail inspection a specified component or assembly.
It is Detail inspection that you do in each zone

Questions.QuestionString: Do you need to use special tool for GVI?
Answers: For clear defect, should use special tool
Needed
No needed

Questions.QuestionString: The goal of EZAP (Enhanced Zonal Analysis Procedure) is:
Answers: Permit appropriate attention to electrical wiring installations,
Permit appropriate attention to aircraft component installations,
Permit appropriate attention to electrical wiring removals,

Questions.QuestionString: The goal of EZAP (Enhanced Zonal Analysis Procedure) achievement by:
Answers: Providing a means to identify tasks to minimize accumulation of combustible materials
Providing a means to identify tasks to address wring installation discrepancies …
Providing a means to identify tasks to minimize accumulation of combustible materials and address wiring installation discrepancies

Questions.QuestionString: What is the correct cleaning method
Answers: Start from the top to the bottom and from the periphery to the center of the area of contamination
Start from the top to the bottom and from the center to the periphery of the area of contamination
Start from the bottom to the top and from the periphery to the center of the area of contamination

Questions.QuestionString: Clean and protect is:
Answers: proactive maintenance.
reactive maintenance.
predictive maintenance.

Questions.QuestionString: What is ESPM?
Answers: Electrical Standard Practices Manual
Electrical Supplemental Procedure Manual
Electrical Supplemental Practices Manual

Questions.QuestionString: If you find the cable of connector is pulled to the rear, need to
Answers: Replace new cable
Replace new connector
Secure loosen cable by tie cable

Questions.QuestionString: How to prevent contamination or damage to the contacts when equipment is disconnected?
Answers: Use protective caps on all connectors (plug or receptacle),
Use the sleeves or plastic bags,
Use protective caps on all connectors (plug or receptacle). Sleeves or plastic bags may be used if protective caps are not available.

Questions.QuestionString: To prevent contamination or damage to the contacts when equipment is disconnected:
Answers: Use of sleeves or plastic bags should be temporary because of the risk of condensation,
Do not use of sleeves or plastic bags,
Permanent use of sleeves or plastic bags.

Questions.QuestionString: If wiring must be displaced (or removed) for work area access:
Answers: It should be adequately released from its clamping (or other restraining provisions) to allow movement without damage and returned after work is completed.
It should be move without released from its clamping,
It should be adequately released from its clamping (or other restraining provisions) to allow movement without damage and keep it in new position after work is completed.

Questions.QuestionString: What is correct statement for maintenance practices gaining access?
Answers: Avoid using wire bundles as handholds, steps and supports,
Work lights should not be hung or supported by wiring,
All answers are correct

Answers: General Variable Interconnection
General Visual Inspection
Ground Visual Inspection

released from the rear and extracted from the front.

twisted lightly in the direction of the lay.

Questions.QuestionString: How many times the harnesses can touch each other?

Answers: Make sure pins & Connector fully engage before tighten the captive screws

Answers: can see the locking stub through the coupling nut
the locking stub is go out of view

Questions.QuestionString: To test crimp tool using GO-NO GO gauge:
Answers: The ‘GO’ end of the gauge should freely pass through indenters when the tool is in the fully closed position.
The ‘NO-GO’ end of the gauge should freely pass through indenters when the tool is in the fully closed position.

Questions.QuestionString: Proper termination of unused wire:
Answers: Terminated with caps, folded back the wire and tie to the bundle or permanent structure. Bend radius must not less than 3 times the outside diameter of the wire.
Terminated with 1-inch piece of insulating tube, folded back the wire and tie to the bundle or permanent structure.
Must be terminated with caps, and properly stowed in the bundle or secured to a permanent structure.

Questions.QuestionString: Clamps on RF cables:
Answers: Should not allow the cables to slide through the clamp when a light axial pull is applied.
Must fit without crushing and must be snug enough to prevent the cable from moving freely through the clamp.
Cable slack should not be left between clamps.

Questions.QuestionString: Wiring on which the outer insulation is brittle when slight flexing causes it to crack:
Answers: If the damaged is less than or equal 10 mm (0.3937 in.), attach the conduits together with a cable tie NSA935401 and install a spacer NSA5586 to prevent rubbing.
If the damaged is more than 10 and less than or equal 25 mm (0.9842 in.), apply teflon adhesive tape ASNA5107 with overlap length 0.75 ± 0.15 inch each side of damaged.
Replace the damaged wire.

Questions.QuestionString: In accordance with Ohm’s law, the value of the resistance is equal to
Answers: the multiplication of thevoltage across the resistor and current passing through theresistor
the division of the current passing through the resistorand the voltage across the resistor
the division of the voltage across the resistor and current passing through the resistor

by spectrum form

Questions.QuestionString: The acronym ARINC means:

Questions.QuestionString: About the ARINC 429 Specification
Answers: High bit rate and low bit rate messages can be intermixed onthe same bus
High bit rate and low bit rate messages cannot be intermixed on the same bus
High bit rate and low bit rate messages cannot be intermixed onthe difference bus

Questions.QuestionString: About the ARINC 429 Specification
Answers: A message is composed of a 32-bit word
A message is composed of a 16-bit word
A message is composed of a 64-bit word

Questions.QuestionString: What is ESD ?
Answers: sudden flow of electricity between two electrically charged objects caused by contact, an electrical short, or dielectric breakdown
a flow of electricity between two electrically charged objects caused by contact
sudden flow of electricity between two electrically charged objects caused by disconnection.
